title: 1,000 jobs in India as part of global layoff
description: Amazon is set to lay off 800 to 1,000 corporate employees in India. This move is part of a larger global job cut of 14,000 people. The company is focusing on artificial intelligence and cost reduction. Affected roles include finance, marketing, HR, and tech. Further job cuts are anticipated in the future as Amazon streamlines operations and seeks efficiency gains.

title: CRA looking at AI, training to help call centre staff provide accurate answers
description: A senior official working at the Canada Revenue Agency says the agency is looking to artificial intelligence and better training to help call centre agents provide more accurate answers to taxpayers.
content:

title: NMC leverages AI to enhance property tax database, boost revenues
description: nagpur municipal corporation (nmc) is increasing leveraging new age technology for fine tuning its data base, mostly relating to property tax, a major revenue gainer. the property tax department tapped into artificial intelligence (ai) in a pilot project implemented at laxmi nagar zone and got startling result that enabled it to properly update its record as to change in nature of property.

title: Amazon to cut 14,000 corporate jobs as spending on AI accelerates
description: amazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs as the online retail giant ramps up spending on artificial intelligence while trimming spending. in june ceo andy jassy, who has aggressively sought to cut costs since becoming ceo in 2021, said that he anticipated generative ai would reduce amazon’s corporate workforce in the next few years. jassy said at the time that amazon had more than 1,000 generative ai services and applications in progress or built, but that figure was a “small fraction” of what it plans t

title: China Amends Cybersecurity Law to Add First
description: China Amends Cybersecurity Law to Add First-Ever AI Clause - The revision, set to take effect in 2026, signals a strategic shift toward governing artificial intelligence through specific existing laws rather than a single comprehensive bill
content: China has amended its landmark Cybersecurity Law for the first time to include a specific article on artificial intelligence, embedding AI governance into a fundamental national security law as it pivots toward a more sector-specific regulatory appro... [345 chars]
